meanings.definition: A future event or circumstance that is possible but cannot be predicted with certainty.
meanings.sent1: We made a plan for any unexpected contingency.
meanings.sent2: The company had to prepare for every possible contingency.
meanings.sent3: The party planner thought of every contingency, even a sudden rainstorm.
meanings.sent4: Life is full of unexpected contingencies that keep us on our toes.
meanings.sent5: Preparing for every contingency is key to a successful project.

meanings.definition: A provision for an unforeseen event or circumstance.
meanings.sent1: Always have a backup contingency in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent2: The insurance policy included a contingency for natural disasters.
meanings.sent3: The chef had a funny contingency plan in case the main dish burned.
meanings.sent4: Having a contingency is like having a safety net in uncertain times.
meanings.sent5: The contingency fund saved the day when unexpected expenses arose.

meanings.definition: Dependent on chance or uncertain conditions.
meanings.sent1: The success of the mission was contingent on the weather.
meanings.sent2: Her happiness was contingent upon the approval of others.
meanings.sent3: The cat's cooperation was contingent on receiving treats.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was contingent on mutual trust and respect.
meanings.sent5: The outcome was contingent on a series of fortunate events.
